# Call functions
```{r Functions}
# delogodd -- de-logs odds ratio when needed
delogodd <- function(x) {
  oddsratio <- exp(x)
  p <- oddsratio / (1 + oddsratio)
  return(p)
}

# NA_preproc -- helps format dataframes with NAs
NA_preproc <- function (dat) {
  for (j in 1:ncol(dat)) {
    x <- dat[[j]]
    if (is.factor(x) && anyNA(x)) dat[[j]] <- base::addNA(x)
    if (is.character(x)) dat[[j]] <- factor(x, exclude = NULL)
  }
  dat
}

  # SEM visualization
plot_matrix <- function(matrix_toplot){
corrplot::corrplot(matrix_toplot, is.corr = FALSE,
               type = 'lower',
               order = "original",
               tl.col='black', tl.cex=.75)
  }
```


# OUTCOME VARIABLE

SUICIDAL IDEATION (si_type)
Creates indicator variable 'si_type' using the subtypes of suicidal ideation using sui_idea, sui_plan, sui_attempt, where: 
  0/0/0 = no SI
  1/0/0 = passive SI
  1/1/0 = active SI
  1/1/1 = volitional
+/- 'phq9_9' and 'sui_idea' into one variable -- suic_idea. Will run the end model twice.


```{r si_type}
data.v2 <- data.v1 %>%

# create si_type var
  mutate(si_type = case_when((sui_idea == 1 & suic_plan == 1 & suic_att == 1) ~ 4, # suicide attempt
                           (sui_idea == 1 & suic_plan == 1) ~ 3,                   # active SI
                           (sui_idea == 1) ~ 2,                                    # passive SI
                           sui_idea == 0 ~ 1)) %>%                                 # no SI reported
  filter(!is.na(si_type))   # filter for SI variable -- then rowwise deletion
data.v2$si_type <- as.factor(data.v2$si_type)  
  # tabulate and check output
table(data.v2$si_type)
table(data.v2$sui_idea)

#data.v2 = subset(data.v2, select= -c(suic_plan, sui_plan, suic_att, sui_att)) # clean up vars/columns

table(data.v2$si_type) # ensuring that all NAs are now clean
data.v2$si_type <- as.factor(data.v2$si_type)
plot(data.v2$si_type)
```

## Gender identity
```{r gender}
data.v3 <- data.v2 %>% 
  # Create 'gender' subtypes into one category
  mutate(gender = case_when((gender == 3 | gender == 4) ~ 3,     # transgender
                            (gender == 5 | gender == 6) ~ 2,     # gender diverse
                            (gender == 1 | gender == 2) ~ 1,     # cis-gender
                            FALSE ~ 4))                          # sets up non-answers
table(data.v3$gender)
  
  # transform into cisgender and non-cisgender
data.v3 <- data.v3 %>%  
  mutate(gender_tgd = case_when(gender == 2 ~ 1,
                                gender == 3 ~ 1,
                                gender == 1 ~ 0)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(gender))
data.v3$gender_tgd <- as.logical(data.v3$gender_tgd)

table(data.v3$gender_tgd, useNA = "always")
jarque.bera.test(data.v3$gender_tgd)
```

### 'Sexual' transformed 
sexual identity: (1) heterosexual; (2) lesbian/gay/bisexual; (3) queer/pan/asex/other, and (4) non-answers
```{r sexual regroup}
data.v5 <- data.v4 %>%
    filter(!is.na(sexual)) %>% 
  # aggregates all 'sexual' answers into one var
  mutate(sexual = case_when((sexual == 9 | sexual == 10 | sexual == 5 | sexual == 6 | sexual == 4) ~ 3,   # queer, nonbinary
                             sexual == 6 ~ 3,  # queer/quest
                             sexual == 2 ~ 2,  # lesbian, gay
                             sexual == 3 ~ 2,  # bisexual
                             sexual == 1 ~ 1,  # heterosexual
                             sexual == 6 ~ 4)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(sexual))
data.v4$sexual <- as.factor(data.v4$sexual) # convert into factors

table(data.v5$sexual, useNA = "always") # tabulate and check outputs
jarque.bera.test(data.v5$sexual)
```

## Co-occuring MH diagnoses
```{r dx_mh}
data.v8 <- data.v7

# To ensure those who skipped the question are not accidentally added to No MH dx category
data.v8$dx_dep[is.na(data.v8$dx_dep)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_anx[is.na(data.v8$dx_anx)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_bi[is.na(data.v8$dx_bi)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_psy[is.na(data.v8$dx_psy)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_ea[is.na(data.v8$dx_ea)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_tr[is.na(data.v8$dx_tr)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_sa[is.na(data.v8$dx_sa)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_neurodev_1[is.na(data.v8$dx_neurodev_1)] <- 0
data.v8$dx_pers[is.na(data.v8$dx_pers)] <- 0

data.v8$dx_adhd <- data.v8$dx_neurodev_1  # rename ADHD to a single category
data.v8$dx_adhd[is.na(data.v8$dx_adhd)] <- 0

data.v9 <- data.v8 %>%   # filters out any respondents who skipped the MH section 
  mutate(dx_mh = case_when(dx_dep == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_anx == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_bi == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_psy == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_ea == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_tr == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_sa == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_adhd == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_pers == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_any == 1 ~ 1,
                           dx_none == 0 ~ 0)) %>%
  mutate(dx_mh = case_when(dx_mh == 1 ~ 1,         # creates dichotomous variable
                           dx_mh == 0 ~ 0,
                           is.na(dx_mh) ~ 0))
data.v9$dx_mh <- as.logical(data.v9$dx_mh)    # turns dx_mh into boolean


table(data.v9$dx_mh, useNA = "always") # Check output, skew
jarque.bera.test(data.v9$dx_mh)
```

```{r train audit_tot}
  # All outputs needs to be numeric for future addition of AUDIT total

         audit_5 = as.numeric(audit_5),

         audit_7 = as.numeric(audit_7),
         audit_8 = as.numeric(audit_8),

         audit_10 = as.numeric(audit_10)) %>%
  # Find audit_tot -- total AUDIT scores for all participants 
  mutate(audit_tot = as.numeric(audit_1) + as.numeric(audit_2) + as.numeric(audit_3) + 
           as.numeric(audit_4) + as.numeric(audit_5) + as.numeric(audit_6) + as.numeric(audit_7) +
```

to see what is associated (i.e. the count is meant to find the common meds in suicidality)
```{r train med_count}
# convert all med vars to numeric for future medcount var totaling

traindf.v11$meds_2 <- as.numeric(traindf.v11$meds_2)

traindf.v11$meds_4 <- as.numeric(traindf.v11$meds_4)
traindf.v11$meds_5 <- as.numeric(traindf.v11$meds_5)
traindf.v11$meds_6 <- as.numeric(traindf.v11$meds_6)
traindf.v11$meds_7 <- as.numeric(traindf.v11$meds_7)
traindf.v11$meds_8 <- as.numeric(traindf.v11$meds_8)

# set any NAs equal to zero
traindf.v11$meds_1[is.na(traindf.v11$meds_1)] <- 0
traindf.v11$meds_2[is.na(traindf.v11$meds_2)] <- 0
traindf.v11$meds_3[is.na(traindf.v11$meds_3)] <- 0
traindf.v11$meds_4[is.na(traindf.v11$meds_4)] <- 0
traindf.v11$meds_5[is.na(traindf.v11$meds_5)] <- 0

# create meds_count var
```

### Diathesis correlation matrix
```{r train diathesis correlation}

# Define diathesis vars for correlation matrix
traindf_dia <- traindf.v12 %>% select(age, sexual, gender_tgd, finpast, sib_freq, race, ed_scoff, body_sr,
                                dx_mh, meds_count, ed_any, meds_sti, meds_dep, meds_psy, meds_anx, meds_mood,
                                meds_sle, meds_oth, no_medther)

# Corr_simple function
corr_simple <- function(traindf=traindf_dia, sig=0.6){
  # convert traindf to numeric in order to run correlations 
  traindf_dia <- traindf_dia %>% mutate_if(is.character, as.factor)
  traindf_dia <-  traindf_dia %>% mutate_if(is.factor, as.numeric)
  # run a correlation and drop the insignificant ones
  corr <- cor(traindf_dia, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")                               
  corr[lower.tri(corr,diag=TRUE)] <- NA                   # prepare to drop duplicates and correlations of 1    
  corr[corr %in% c(-1, 1)] <- NA                          # drop perfect correlations
  corr <- as.data.frame(as.table(corr))                   # turn into a 3-column table
  corr <- na.omit(corr)                                   # remove the NA values from above 
  corr <- corr[order(-abs(corr$Freq)),]                   # inspect correlations above 0.60
  print(corr)
  
  #turn corr back into matrix in order to plot with corrplot
  mtx_corr <- acast(corr, Var1~Var2, value.var="Freq")  
  corrplot(mtx_corr, is.corr=FALSE, tl.col="black", na.label=" ")
}
corr_simple()

# Extracting overlapping vars to visualize correlation for regression
traindf_dia <- traindf.v12 %>% select(age, sexual, gender_tgd, finpast, sib_freq, race, 
                                      body_sr, ed_any, dx_mh, meds_count, meds_sti, meds_dep, 
                                      meds_psy, meds_anx, meds_mood, meds_sle, meds_oth, no_medther)

# Corr_simple function
corr_simple <- function(traindf=traindf_dia, sig=0.6){
  # convert traindf to numeric in order to run correlations 
  traindf_dia <- traindf_dia %>% mutate_if(is.character, as.factor)
  traindf_dia <-  traindf_dia %>% mutate_if(is.factor, as.numeric)
  # run a correlation and drop the insignificant ones
  corr <- cor(traindf_dia, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")                               
  corr[lower.tri(corr,diag=TRUE)] <- NA                   # prep to drop duplicates and correlations of 1    
  corr[corr %in% c(-1, 1)] <- NA                          # drop perfect correlations
  corr <- as.data.frame(as.table(corr))                   # turn into a 3-column table
  corr <- na.omit(corr)                                   # remove the NA values from above 
  corr <- corr[order(-abs(corr$Freq)),]                   # sort by highest correlation
  print(corr)
  
  #turn corr back into matrix in order to plot with corrplot
  mtx_corr <- acast(corr, Var1~Var2, value.var="Freq")  
  corrplot(mtx_corr, is.corr=FALSE, tl.col="black", na.label=" ")
}
corr_simple()
```

### EFA diathesis
```{r train PCA diathesis}
# ID columns to utilized in PCA
traindf_dia <- traindf.v12 %>% select(age, sexual, gender_tgd, finpast, sib_freq, race,
                                      dx_mh, ed_any, no_medther)
traindf_dia <- na.omit(traindf_dia)    # filters NAs out

# create corr matrix, with dummy vars
traindf_dia <- traindf_dia %>% 
  mutate_if(is.numeric, as.factor) %>% 
  mutate(
    age = as.numeric(age)
  ) %>% 
  dummy_cols(remove_first_dummy = TRUE) %>% 
  data.matrix()
traindf_dia   # check output

# create dummy columns for EFA analysis
results_dia <- dummy_cols(traindf_dia, select_columns = c("age", "sexual", "gender_tgd", "finpast", 
                                                       "sib_freq", "race", "dx_mh", "ed_any", "no_medther"), 
                          remove_first_dummy = TRUE, remove_selected_columns = TRUE)

# factoextra -- https://rpkgs.traindfnovia.com/factoextra/
dia_pca <- PCA(results_dia, graph=FALSE)  # apply PCA
eigval_dia <- get_eigenvalue(dia_pca)
eigval_dia

fviz_screeplot(dia_pca, addlabels = TRUE, ylim = c(0, 50))

fviz_pca_var(dia_pca,
             col.var = "contrib", # Color by contributions to the PC
             gradient.cols = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
             repel = TRUE     # Avoid text overlapping
             )
fviz_famd_var(dia_pca,
             col.var = "contrib", # Color by contributions to the PC
             gradient.cols = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
             repel = TRUE     # Avoid text overlapping
             )
fviz_cos2(dia_pca, choice = "var", axes = 1, 
          fill = "steelblue", color = "steelblue",
          sort.val = c("desc", "asc", "none"),
          top = 40,
          xtickslab.rt = 45,
          ggtheme = theme_minimal())
```

### CLM diathesis regression
```{r train clm_dia}
# setting up dataframe for regression analysis
clm_dia <- traindf.v12 %>% select(si_type, age, sexual, gender_tgd, sib_freq, race,
                                  ed_any, dx_mh, no_medther)
clm_dia <- na.omit(clm_dia)
dia_mod <- as.data.frame(clm_dia)

# regression call
dia_mod <- clm(si_type ~ ., data = dia_mod)

# check output
summary(dia_mod)
coef(dia_mod)

ci_dia <- confint(dia_mod)  # find find confidence intervals
ci_dia

model.dia <- tidy(dia_mod)  # Convert model to dataframe for easy manipulation
model.dia
model.dia  %>%
   mutate(or = exp(estimate),  # Odds ratio/gradient
          var.diag = diag(vcov(dia_mod)),  # Variance of each coefficient
          or.se = sqrt(or^2 * var.diag))  # Odds-ratio adjusted
```

## ENVIRONMENT ANALYSES

```{r train env analysis}
traindf.v15 <- traindf.v14  # new dataframe for analysis
```

### Environmental correlation
```{r train env correlation}
# Define environment vars for correlation matrix
traindf_env <- traindf.v15 %>% select(discrim, religios, residenc, activ_no, divers, 
                                school2_type, military, international)

 # Convert traindf to numeric in order to run correlations
traindf_env <- traindf_env %>% mutate_if(is.character, as.factor)
traindf_env <-  traindf_env %>% mutate_if(is.factor, as.numeric)
traindf_env <-  traindf_env %>% mutate_if(is.logical, as.numeric)

# run a correlation and drop the insignificant ones
corr <- cor(traindf_env, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")                               
corr[lower.tri(corr,diag=TRUE)] <- NA                   # prepare to drop duplicates and correlations of 1    
corr[corr %in% c(-1, 1)] <- NA                          # drop perfect correlations
corr <- as.data.frame(as.table(corr))                   #turn into a 3-column table
corr <- na.omit(corr)                                   #remove the NA values from above 
corr <- corr[order(-abs(corr$Freq)), ]                   #sort by highest correlation
print(corr)
  
# turn corr back into matrix in order to plot with corrplot
mtx_corr <- acast(corr, Var1~Var2, value.var="Freq")  
corrplot(mtx_corr, is.corr=FALSE, tl.col="black", na.label=" ")
```

##EFA Environment
```{r train EFA Environment}
# bring in environmental variables for analysis
traindf_env <- traindf.v15 %>% select(religios, residenc, activ_no, school2_type, 
                                      military, international)
traindf_env <- NA_preproc(traindf_env)

# create corr matrix, with dummy vars
traindf_env <- traindf_env %>% 
  mutate_if(is.numeric, as.factor) %>% 
  dummy_cols(remove_first_dummy = TRUE) %>% 
  data.matrix()
traindf_env   # check output

# PCA map with eigenvalues
results_env <- dummy_cols(traindf_env, select_columns = c("religios", "residenc", "activ_no",
                                                         "school2_type", "military", "international"),
                          remove_first_dummy = TRUE, remove_selected_columns = TRUE)

env_pca <- PCA(results_env, graph=FALSE)  # apply PCA
names(env_pca)
summary(env_pca)

eigval_env <- get_eigenvalue(env_pca)
eigval_env

# Visualization
fviz_screeplot(env_pca, addlabels = TRUE, ylim = c(0, 50))
fviz_pca_var(env_pca,
             col.var = "contrib", # Color by contributions to the PC
             gradient.cols = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
             repel = TRUE     # Avoid text overlapping
             )
fviz_famd_var(env_pca,
             col.var = "contrib", # Color by contributions to the PC
             gradient.cols = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
             repel = TRUE     # Avoid text overlapping
             )
fviz_cos2(env_pca, choice = "var", axes = 1,
          fill = "steelblue", color = "steelblue",
          sort.val = c("desc", "asc", "none"),
          top = 40,
          xtickslab.rt = 45,
          ggtheme = theme_minimal())
```

### CLM environmental regression
```{r train CLM environment}
# preparing dataframe for regression
clm_env <- traindf.v15 %>% select(si_type, religios, residenc, activ_no, school2_type, 
                                  international, discrim, military)
clm_env <- NA_preproc(clm_env) %>% 
  as.data.frame()

# run ordinal regression
clm_env2 <- clm(si_type ~ religios + residenc + activ_no + school2_type + international +
                        discrim,
                data = clm_env)

summary(clm_env2)
coef(clm_env2)

ci_env2 <- confint(clm_env2)
ci_env2

model.dia <- tidy(clm_env2)  # Convert model to dataframe
model.dia
model.dia  %>%
   mutate(or = exp(estimate),  # Odds ratio/gradient
          var.diag = diag(vcov(clm_env2)),  # Coefficient variances
          or.se = sqrt(or^2 * var.diag))  # Odds-ratio adjusted
```

```{r train results_prem}
# Define diathesis vars for correlation matrix
traindf_prem <- traindf.v19 %>% select(si_type, age, sexual, gender_tgd, sib_freq, race, ed_any, dx_mh, 
                                       no_medther, religios, activ_no, school2_type, ins_no, residenc,

# Corr_simple function
corr_simple <- function(traindf=traindf_prem, sig=0.6){
  # convert traindf to numeric in order to run correlations 
  traindf_prem <- traindf_prem %>% mutate_if(is.character, as.factor)
  traindf_prem <-  traindf_prem %>% mutate_if(is.factor, as.numeric)
  # run a correlation and drop the insignificant ones
  corr <- cor(traindf_prem, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")                               
  corr[lower.tri(corr,diag=TRUE)] <- NA                   # prepare to drop duplicates and correlations of 1    
  corr[corr %in% c(-1, 1)] <- NA                          # drop perfect correlations
  corr <- as.data.frame(as.table(corr))                   # turn into a 3-column table
  corr <- na.omit(corr)                                   # remove the NA values from above 
  corr <- corr[order(-abs(corr$Freq)),]                   # sort by highest correlation
  print(corr)
  
  #turn corr back into matrix in order to plot with corrplot
  mtx_corr <- acast(corr, Var1~Var2, value.var="Freq")  
  corrplot(mtx_corr, is.corr=FALSE, tl.col="black", na.label=" ")
}
corr_simple()

# run regression
clm_prem <- clm(si_type ~ .,
              data = traindf_prem)
summary(clm_prem)
coef(clm_prem)
```

```{r train deprawsc}

traindf.v20 <- traindf.v20 %>%
  mutate(dep_none = case_when(deprawsc < 5 ~ 1,   # creates bin for no/minimal depression
                              deprawsc > 4 ~ 0)) %>%
  mutate(dep_mild = case_when((deprawsc > 4 & deprawsc < 10) ~ 1,  # bin for mild depression
                              (deprawsc < 5 | deprawsc > 9) ~ 0)) %>%
  mutate(dep_mod = case_when((deprawsc > 9 & deprawsc < 15) ~ 1,    # bin for moderate depression
                             (deprawsc > 14 | deprawsc < 10) ~ 0)) %>%
  mutate(dep_modsev = case_when((deprawsc > 14 & deprawsc < 20) ~ 1,   # bin for mod-severe depression
                               (deprawsc > 19 | deprawsc < 15) ~ 0)) %>%
  mutate(dep_sev = case_when(deprawsc > 19 ~ 1,    # bin for severe depression
                             deprawsc < 20 ~ 0)) %>%
  mutate(dep_na = case_when(is.na(deprawsc) ~ 1,   #  filter out any NAs
                            !is.na(deprawsc) ~ 0))
traindf.v20$deprawsc <- as.numeric(traindf.v20$deprawsc)

# Check outputs

table(traindf.v20$dep_mild)
table(traindf.v20$dep_mod)
table(traindf.v20$dep_modsev)
table(traindf.v20$dep_sev)
table(traindf.v20$dep_na)
```

## AAQ total
```{r train aaq_dum}
# create AAQ_tot variable to sum up imputed AAQ questions
traindf.v22 <- traindf.v22 %>%
  mutate(aaq_tot = as.numeric(AAQ_1) + as.numeric(AAQ_2) + as.numeric(AAQ_3) + as.numeric(AAQ_4) + 
           as.numeric(AAQ_5) + as.numeric(AAQ_6) + as.numeric(AAQ_7))

table(traindf.v22$aaq_tot) # check output

#  for loop for predictive cutoff point needed
 rs_df <- data.frame("cutoff" = c(), "rs" = c())
 for (i in 8:48) {
   aaq_bin <- ifelse(traindf.v22$aaq_tot >= i, TRUE, FALSE)
   model = lm(traindf.v22$sui_idea ~ aaq_bin)
   rs_df <- rbind(rs_df, c(i, summary(model)$r.squared))

 }
 names(rs_df) <- c("cutoff", "rs")
 rs_df_arranged <- rs_df %>%
   arrange(desc(rs))
 rs_df_arranged[1,1]

# deem 'rs_df_arranged[1,1]' as SI cutoff
 traindf.v22 <- traindf.v22 %>%
   mutate(aaq_dum = ifelse(aaq_tot > rs_df_arranged[1,1], 1, 0)) %>%
   mutate(aaq_dum = case_when(aaq_dum == 1 ~ 1,
                              aaq_dum == 0 ~ 0)) %>%
   filter(!is.na(aaq_dum))   # filter for NAs
traindf.v22$aaq_dum <- as.logical(traindf.v22$aaq_dum)  # change to boolean
```

```{r train CLM TSM}
         or.se = sqrt(or^2 * var.diag))  # Odds-ratio adjusted
```

### Motivational Moderator correlation
```{r train MM_corr}
# Define MM variable candidates for correlation matrix
traindf_mm <- traindf.v27 %>% select(inf, flourish_dum, belong1, talk, mh_stigma, satisfied_overall)

 # convert traindf to numeric in order to run correlations
traindf_mm <- traindf_mm %>% mutate_if(is.character, as.factor)
traindf_mm <-  traindf_mm %>% mutate_if(is.factor, as.numeric)

# run a correlation and drop the insignificant ones
corr <- cor(traindf_mm, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")                               
corr[lower.tri(corr,diag=TRUE)] <- NA                   # prepare to drop duplicates and correlations of 1    
corr[corr %in% c(-1, 1)] <- NA                          # drop perfect correlations
corr <- as.data.frame(as.table(corr))                   # turn into a 3-column table
corr <- na.omit(corr)                                   # remove the NA values from above 
corr <- corr[order(-abs(corr$Freq)),]                   # sort by highest correlation
print(corr)

mtx_corr <- acast(corr, Var1~Var2, value.var="Freq")  
corrplot(mtx_corr, is.corr=FALSE, tl.col="black", na.label=" ")

```

# MISSINGNESS


## Absolute missingness, by school
```{r train structural missingness, by school}
traindf.v28 <- traindf.v26
# school structural analysis
var_names <- c(
  # diathesis
  "age", "sexual", "gender_tgd", "sib_freq", "ed_any", "dx_mh", "no_medther",
  # environment
  "religios", "school2_type", "activ_no", "residenc", "discrim", "international",
  # life events
  "ins_no", "gpa_sr", "binge", "psyhx", "fincur", "drugs_yn", "assault", "drug_mar",
  # defeat
  "aca_impa", "deprawsc", "anx_score",
  # threats to self-moderation
  "persist", "aaq_dum",
  # entrapment
  "dep_impa", "gad7_impa", "percneed",
  # motivational moderators
  "inf", "flourish_dum", "belong1", "talk", "satisfied_overall", "mh_stigma")  
var_names <- sort(var_names)

# build table for absolute missingness based on school2
school2 <- count(traindf.v28, school2)
school2_ncol <- ncol(school2)

for (j in 1:length(var_names)) {
  school2[, school2_ncol + j] <- 999
}

# create column headers and vectors for school, total students, then each variable count
names <- c("school2_values", "total", var_names)
names(school2) <- names

# input values for each school missingness across all variables
for (j in 1:(length(var_names))) {
for (i in 1:nrow(school2)) {   # i corresponds to rows, j to columns
  school2[i, 2 + j] <- sum(!is.na(traindf.v28[traindf.v28$school2 == school2[[i,1]], var_names[j]]))
}
}
# add percentage in each column
school2_m <- as.matrix(school2[-1]) 
props <- school2_m[,2:ncol(school2_m)] / school2_m[,1]
school2 <- data.frame(school2[, 1:2], props)

# view missingness matrix
view(school2)

# save matrix
write_xlsx(school2, path = "sch2_missing.xlsx", col_names = TRUE, format_headers = TRUE)
```

```{r si_model_tr1}
                  def =~ deprawsc + aca_impa + anx_score

                  mm =~ flourish_dum + inf + belong1 + satisfied_overall + mh_stigma

                # structural model - regressions
                   si ~ prem + def + tsm + def*tsm + entrap + mm + entrap*mm     '
```

```{r si_model_tr2}
SI_model_trM <- '
                # measurement model
                
                  si =~    si_type_3 + si_type_2 + si_type_4
    
                  prem  =~ sib_freq + sexual_2 + sexual_3 + gender_tgd + no_medther +
                           ed_any + dx_mh + religios + international +activ_no + ins_no + 
                           gpa_sr + binge + psyhx + fincur + drugs_yn + assault + drug_mar
                          
                   def =~ dep_type + aca_impa + anx_type
                              
                   tsm =~ aaq_dum + persist

                   entrap =~ dep_impa + gad7_impa + percneed

                   mm =~ flourish_dum + inf + belong1 + satisfied_overall + mh_stigma

                # structural model - regressions
                   si ~ prem + def + tsm + def*tsm + entrap + mm + entrap*mm 

                # residual covars
                  dx_mh ~~ ed_any
                  assault ~~ dx_mh
                  activ_no	~~	belong1
                  drugs_yn ~~ drug_mar   '
```

```{r si_model_tr3}
## Dummy col SEM w/ continuous
results_tr_com1 <- dummy_cols(traindf_sem1, select_columns = c("si_type", "sexual"),
                         remove_first_dummy = TRUE, remove_selected_columns = TRUE)

SI_model_trM2 <- '
                # measurement model
                
                  si =~    si_type_3 + si_type_2 + si_type_4
    
                  prem  =~ sib_freq + sexual_2 + sexual_3 + gender_tgd + assault +
                           ed_any + dx_mh + psyhx + fincur + drugs_yn + no_medther
                          
                  def =~ deprawsc + aca_impa + anx_score
                              
                  tsm =~ aaq_dum + persist

                  entrap =~ dep_impa + gad7_impa + percneed

                   mm =~ flourish_dum + inf + belong1 + satisfied_overall

                # structural model - regressions
                   si ~ prem + def + tsm + def*tsm + entrap + mm + entrap*mm 

                # residual covars
                  dx_mh ~~ ed_any
                  assault ~~ dx_mh
                  drugs_yn ~~ drug_mar '

fit_trainM2 <- sem(SI_model_trM2, data=results_tr_com1, ordered=T)
```

```{r new_model_base}
SI_model_new<- '
                # measurement model
                    si =~      si_type_3 + si_type_2 + si_type_4
    
                    prem =~    sib_freq + sexual_2 + sexual_3 + gender_tgd +
                               ed_any + dx_mh + no_medther + gpa_sr + binge + psyhx + 
                               fincur + drugs_yn + assault
                          
                    deftrap =~ dep_type + aca_impa + anx_type + dep_impa
                              
                    mmtsm =~   aaq_dum + persist + flourish_dum + inf + belong1 + satisfied_overall + mh_stigma 

                 # structural model - regressions
                   si ~ prem + deftrap + mmtsm + deftrap*mmtsm '

fit_trainM3 <- sem(SI_model_new, data=results_tr_com1, ordered=T)
summary_train3 <- summary(fit_trainM3, fit.measures=TRUE, standardized = TRUE, rsquare=T)
fitMeasures(fit_trainM3, fit.measures = "all")
parameterestimates(fit_trainM3, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE) 

modificationindices(fit_trainM3, minimum.value = 20)
```

```{r pls_new_model_base}
# Pull file
data.pls <- read_excel("~/Desktop/results_tr_com1.xlsx",
                       range=cell_cols(1:27), col_types = "numeric")
save("data.pls", file="~/Desktop/data.pls.RData")
load("~/Desktop/data.pls.RData")

data.pls <- as.data.frame(data.pls)
data.pls <- na.omit(data.pls)

# INNER MODEL
# rows of path matrix
prem =     c(0, 1, 0, 0)
deftrap =  c(0, 0, 1, 0)
mmtsm =    c(0, 0, 0, 1)
si =       c(0, 0, 0, 0)

# matrix (by row binding)
imv_path = rbind (prem, deftrap, mmtsm, si)
imv_path = t(imv_path)

# plot the inner matrix
innerplot(imv_path, box.size = 0.1)

# outer model
imv_blocks = list(4:16, 17:21, 22:27, 1:3)

# modes
imv_modes = c("B", "A", "A", "A")

#scales
imv_scales = list(
            # premotivation
                  c("ord","ord","ord",
                  "num", "num", "num", "num", "ord", 
                  "num", "num", "num", "num", "ord"), 
            # deftrap      
                  c("ord", "ord", "ord", "ord", "num"),
            # mmtsm    
                  c("ord", "ord", "num", "ord", "ord","ord"),
            # si     
                  c("ord","ord","ord")
                  )
  
# apply plspm
imv_pls1 = plspm(data.pls, imv_path, imv_blocks, modes = imv_modes, scaling = imv_scales)

# print diss_pls1
imv_pls1


## Partial Least Squares Path Modeling (PLS-PM)
## ---------------------------------------------
##    NAME                   DESCRIPTION
## 1  $outer_model           outer model
## 2  $inner_model           inner model
## 3  $path_coefs            path coefficients matrix
## 4  $scores                latent variable scores 
## 5  $crossloadings         cross-loadings
## 6  $inner_summary         summary inner model
## 7  $effects               total effects
## 8  $unidim                uni-dimensionality
## 9  $gof                   goodness-of-fit
## 10 $boot                  bootstrap results
## 11 $data                  data matrix
## ---------------------------------------------

# check unidimensionality
imv_pls1$unidim

# check coefs
imv_pls1$path_coefs
imv_pls1$inner_model

# plotting the loadings
plot(imv_pls1, what = "loadings")

# check outer model
imv_pls1$outer_model

# summarized results
summary(imv_pls1)
plot(imv_pls1)
plot(imv_pls1, what = "loadings", arr.width = 0.1)
head(imv_pls1$scores, n = 5)
tail(imv_pls1$scores, n = 5)
imv_pls1$outer_model     #outer model
imv_pls1$inner_model     #inner model
imv_pls1$path_coefs      #path coefficients matrix
imv_pls1$scores          #latent variable scores
imv_pls1$crossloadings   #cross-loadings
imv_pls1$inner_summary   #summary inner model
imv_pls1$effects         #total effects
imv_pls1$unidim          #uni-dimensionality
imv_pls1$gof             #goodness-of-fit
imv_pls1$boot            #bootstrap results
imv_pls1$data            #data matrix
```

# SEM model with partial cont and dummy
```{r si_model_test1}
## Dummy col SEM w/ continuous
results_test_com1 <- dummy_cols(testdf_sem1, select_columns = c("si_type", "sexual"),
                         remove_first_dummy = TRUE, remove_selected_columns = TRUE)
# view(results_tr_com1)

SI_model_test1 <- '
                # measurement model
                
                  si =~    si_type_3 + si_type_2 + si_type_4
    
                  prem  =~ sib_freq + sexual_2 + sexual_3 + gender_tgd + assault +
                           ed_any + dx_mh + no_medther + psyhx + fincur + drugs_yn 
                          
                   def =~ dep_type + aca_impa + anx_type
                              
                   tsm =~ aaq_dum + persist

                   entrap =~ dep_impa + gad7_impa

                   mm =~ flourish_dum + inf + belong1 + satisfied_overall

                # structural model - regressions
                   si ~ prem + def + tsm + def*tsm + entrap + mm + entrap*mm 

                # residual covars
                  dx_mh ~~ ed_any
                  assault ~~ dx_mh
                  activ_no	~~	belong1
                  drugs_yn ~~ drug_mar
                  anx_type	~~	gad7_impa  
                  dep_type	~~	dep_impa    '


fit_test1 <- sem(SI_model_test1, data=results_test_com1, ordered=T)
summary_test <- summary(fit_test1, fit.measures=TRUE, standardized = TRUE)
fitMeasures(fit_test1, fit.measures = "all")

    ## running NULL model, baseline model RMSEA
nullRMSEA(fit_test1, scaled = FALSE, silent = FALSE)

    ## modification indices
modificationindices(fit_test1, minimum.value = 20)
```

```{r SI_test_new}
SI_test_new<- '
                # measurement model
                    si =~      si_type_3 + si_type_2 + si_type_4
    
                    prem =~    sib_freq + sexual_2 + sexual_3 + gender_tgd +
                               ed_any + dx_mh + no_medther + gpa_sr + binge + psyhx + 
                               fincur + drugs_yn + assault
                          
                    deftrap =~ dep_type + aca_impa + anx_type + dep_impa
                              
                    mmtsm =~   aaq_dum + persist + flourish_dum + inf + belong1 + satisfied_overall + mh_stigma 

                 # structural model - regressions
                   si ~ prem + deftrap + mmtsm + deftrap*mmtsm '

fit_testM4 <- sem(SI_test_new, data=results_tr_com1, ordered=T)
summary_test4 <- summary(fit_testM4, fit.measures=TRUE, standardized = TRUE, rsquare=T)
```

```{r 20-25 frame}
fit_test2_upp <- sem(SI_test_new, data=results_20_com, ordered=T)
summary_test2_upp <- summary(fit_test2_upp, fit.measures=TRUE, standardized = TRUE, rsquare=T)
fitMeasures(fit_test2_upp, fit.measures = "all")
parameterestimates(fit_test2_upp, boot.ci.type = "bca.simple", standardized = TRUE) 

modificationindices(fit_test2_upp, minimum.value = 20)
```
